title: (x) Oregon Ducks - Handel Gothic (customized) {Yves}
content:
I am in need of an University of Oregon (Ducks) font. I am having trouble finding it online, I was hoping one of you could help me. I see it's been asked before on here but i didn't see an answer. Thanks either way.   
   
 [http://www.sportsfanfare.com/1588996051.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015932/http:/www.sportsfanfare.com/1588996051.html)   
   
I'm interested in the "O" logo and the "Oregon" font.
author: nicezombie

comments.content: Thank ya troubleman. Now if I could trouble you with one more question, what would be the best typeface editing program for a rookie to use to make said changes. You could look at my username like that I suppose, but I think of it like someone pointing and saying, "Now that's a nice friggin zombie."

"Oregon" was set in [Handel Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015932/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/handel-gothic/handel-gothic/testdrive.html?s=OREGON&p=48) and customized\*.   
I really don't know what the big 'O' should be: it's very   
difficult to ID a font just by one character that carries so   
little specific traits.   
   
\*stretched horizontally, converted the upper left curve   
on the "E" to a corner, flipped the "U" for the "N" and   
also converted the upper left curve to a corner. Not too   
difficult to recreate.
Does your nick mean you prowl but you don't bite? ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015932im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150302015932im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)   
If you only need the logo, convert the type to outlines   
in Adobe Illustrator, Macromedia Freehand or CorelDraw.   
No need to make a custom typeface for that.
